metadata.Title: CVE-2017-5335 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The stream reading functions in lib/opencdk/read-packet.c in GnuTLS before 3.3.26 and 3.5.x before 3.5.8 allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (out-of-memory error and crash) via a crafted OpenPGP certificate.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5335` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gnutls-bin - 3.4.10-4ubuntu1.2
guile-gnutls - 3.4.10-4ubuntu1.2
libgnutls-openssl27 - 3.4.10-4ubuntu1.2
libgnutls30 - 3.4.10-4ubuntu1.2
libgnutlsxx28 - 3.4.10-4ubuntu1.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: gnutls28 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.4.10-4ubuntu1.2').
